thread.title: Reckless teens climb to ROOF of 800ft Canary Wharf skyscraper then film themselves balancing on edge
thread.title_full: Reckless teens climb to ROOF of 800ft Canary Wharf skyscraper then film themselves balancing on edge

author: Rachel Bishop
title: Reckless teens climb to ROOF of 800ft Canary Wharf skyscraper then film themselves balancing on edge
text:
News Reckless teens climb to ROOF of 800ft Canary Wharf skyscraper then film themselves balancing on edge Two men leap over security barriers in the One Canada Square before they climb to the highest level - where they claimed to have found the doors to the roof unlocked Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Urban climbers scale the roof of a London skyscraper Share this video Get daily   Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A reckless pair of thrill-seekers climbed to the top of Canary Wharf's towering One Canada Square - the second tallest building in London. 
During the clip two men leap over security barriers in the building and get the lift and stairs to the highest floor. 
They then climb from level 50 onto the roof - claiming the door to the outside had been left unlocked. 
They then film themselves dangling 800ft (230m) above the ground and even touch the top of the famous pyramid at the summit of the iconic building. They film themselves dangling more than 230m above the ground 
The 10-and-a-half minute clip was posted to YouTube channel Night Scape, where they described the challenge as “almost impossible.” 
During the clip one of them said: “We are going to try to infiltrate the building called One Canada Square. 
He adds: "Guys I can’t believe we are on here it is crazy. The pair describe the climb as “almost impossible" (Photo: Night Scape/Youtube) 
“Should we touch the top? I need to touch the top of the building. I have done it. I have touched the top of Canary Wharf. 
“My heart is pounding. We can literally see the whole of London, just everything.” 
An Instagram account claiming to represent Night Scape features pictures of the terrifying climb. 
Posting images on the page under Harry Gallagher, 19, an image shared yesterday show a masked man hanging from One Canada Square. Police are aware of the footage (Photo: Night Scape/Youtube) https://www.instagram.com/p/BP77VTNjhiF/?taken-by=night.scape&hl=en/embed 
Canary Wharf Group, which owns One Canada Square, has been contacted for a comment. 
A Met Police spokesman said: "The Metropolitan Police Service is aware of footage online depicting people gaining unauthorised access One Canada Square. "We will liaise with the building operators to assess whether any offences have been committed. "It is unknown when the footage was taken. "Enquiries continue and no arrests." Like us on Facebook
